newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Internet providers mull cheap phone service.
newsitem.headline: Japan Internet providers mull cheap phone service.

text.p: Japan's Internet access providers said on Wednesday that they are studying plans to offer international call services over the Internet at rates one-third of those currently offered by Japanese carriers.
A spokesman at Internet provider, Tokyo Internet, said the daytime rate for a three-minute call connecting Japan and the United States would be in the range of 100 and 150 yen.
"We expect large demand for such cut-rate services," he said, adding that the firm has not made a decision yet on business plans or tariffs.
Japan's biggest international carrier Kokusai Denshin Denwa Co currently offers the service at 450 yen.
International carriers said Internet phones would not be a threat to their services due to poor sound quality.
Japan announced earlier this week it would liberalise Internet-based international phone services from August.
